titleStmt.title: A suddain flash timely discovering, some reasons wherefore, the stile of Protector, should not be deserted by these nations, with some other things, by them very considerable. It was first made visible, the fourth day, after the author heard it reported, that the Lord Protector, had waved the title of King. / By Britans remembrancer.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J.S. in little Britain, and are to be sold there, and at the Pile of Bibles, in the corner shop of the east end of the Fish-market in the Stocks; looking into Lumbard street;,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Pile of Bibles, in the corner shop of the east end of the Fish-market in the Stocks; looking into Lumbard street
